intro: Tithymalus valdevillosocarpa, commonly known as the Valdevillo's tithymalus, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are finely divided, resembling those of other members of the carrot family. The fruit is a small, dry schizocarp, which splits into two one-seeded parts upon maturity.
